'''Cinccino''' ([[List of Japanese Pokémon names|Japanese]]: '''チラチーノ''' ''Chillaccino'') is a {{type|Normal}} {{OBP|Pokémon|species}} introduced in [[Generation V]].

It [[evolution|evolves]] from {{p|Minccino}} when exposed to a [[Shiny Stone]].

==Biology==
[[File:Cinccino cleaning.png|thumb|left|250px|Cinccino cleaning itself]]
Cinccino is a furry, gray chinchilla-like Pokémon. It has large ears located to the sides of its head, with red insides partly covered by tufts of fur. Its eyes are large and brown, with a small, rounded nose. Its limbs are somewhat rounded and small, and its tail is long, fluffy and incredibly white in color. It also has two large long fluffs on its head that wrap around its back. 

Cinccino uses its long fur as a scarf. <!--Pokédex 3D confirms that the two fur strands on its head and the scarf are separate.-->Its fur is coated in a special oil that repels enemy attacks, and can also be used as skin treatment. Its fur feels amazing to touch, and it repels dust and prevents static electricity from building up. Cinccino and its pre-evolution are the [[Signature move|only known Pokémon]] capable of learning {{m|Tail Slap}}. <br clear=left>

==In the anime==
[[File:Moira Cinccino.png|thumb|left|250px|Cinccino in the {{pkmn|anime}}]]
===Major appearances===
A Cinccino appeared in ''[[BW098|Beauties Battling for Pride and Prestige!]]'', under the ownership of [[Moira]]. She battled [[Ash's Snivy]] and lost. She was often referred to as "Cinccinoette" by her {{pkmn|Trainer}}.

===Minor appearances===
Cinccino debuted in ''[[M14|White—Victini and Zekrom and Black—Victini and Reshiram]]''.

A Cinccino appeared in ''[[M15|Kyurem VS. The Sword of Justice]]'', during the {{OBP|Swords of Justice|M15}} legend.

A Cinccino appeared in ''[[BW090|Jostling for the Junior Cup!]]'', under the ownership of [[Horatio]]. It participated in the [[Pokémon World Tournament Junior Cup]]. Cinccino was first seen defeating [[Simeon]]'s {{p|Zebstrika}}, but it later went up against [[Cilan's Stunfisk]] and lost to a {{m|Sludge Bomb}}.

A Cinccino briefly appeared in ''[[BW126|Crowning the Scalchop King!]]'', where [[Ash's Oshawott]] immediately fell in love with it after getting over Osharina.

A Cinccino appeared in ''[[M16|Genesect and the Legend Awakened]]''.

==In the manga==
[[File:Geoff Cinccino Adventures.png|thumb|150px|Cinccino in [[Pokémon Adventures]]]]
===In the Pokémon Adventures manga===
Janitor Geoff owns a Cinccino that he used to battle {{adv|Black}} in ''[[PS476|A Direct Attack and a Daunting Defense]]''. Its fur prevented it from being hurt by {{type|Electric}} attacks but was defeated when Black used a strategy to get around it.

In ''[[PS478|Big City Battles]]'', a Cinccino was briefly seen under the ownership of one of [[Castelia City]]'s residents.

==Trivia==
* Due to an error, Cinccino is unable to learn {{m|Thief}} via [[TM]] in {{game|Black and White|s}}, while its pre-evolution {{p|Minccino}} does. This issue was later fixed in {{2v2|Black|White|2}}.
* Cinccino and its pre-evolution Minccino were designed by [[Atsuko Nishida]].

===Origin===
Cinccino is based on a {{wp|chinchilla}}. Its white "hair" is very similar in appearance to {{wp|1600–1650 in fashion#Style gallery 1600–1620|high class women's hairstyles in the early 1600s}}. The white fur draped around its neck resembles {{wp|shawl}}s, {{wp|scarf}}s and {{wp|feather boa|boas}}, possibly a reference to how chinchillas are controversially hunted for their fur.

====Name origin====
Cinccino and Chillaccino may be a combination of ''{{wp|chinchilla}}'' and ''{{wp|chino cloth}}''.
